data.Title: Google Ads to Sunset Enhanced CPC in March 2025
data.Description: Google Ads is saying goodbye to Enhanced CPC next March 2025. It will be migrated to Manual CPC bidding.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Now Sends Broken Appointment Link Notifications
data.Description: Google Business Profiles is sending email notifications when appointment links are broken.

data.Title: Bing May Soon Support ProductGroup Markup
data.Description: Bing may soon start supporting ProductGroup markup for its "captions" in search results. The team is closely monitoring its adoption.

data.Title: Bing Treats 308 Redirects the Same as 301 Redirects
data.Description: Bing Search treats 308 redirects the same as 301 redirects, similar to Google's stance since 2021.

data.Title: Bing Search Tests "See Details" Button for Product Listings
data.Description: Bing is testing a large blue "see details" button for some product listings in its search results.  Hovering over products expands them, and now a blue button to "see details" is also displayed.

data.Title: Product Carousels Return to AI Overviews for Commercial Queries
data.Description: Product carousels are appearing again for product-focused queries with a mix of commercial and informational intent, currently ranked by a combination of guides.

data.Title: Apple Unveils "Visual Intelligence" for Enhanced Search
data.Description: Apple's new "Visual Intelligence" feature offers local and shopping search assistance, similar to Google Lens. It integrates with Google and other services.

data.Title: Mediavine Bans Publisher for Excessive Use of AI-Generated Content
data.Description: Mediavine has banned a publisher for overusing AI-generated content. The Director of Ad Operations and Market Quality stated that their top partners would stop spending on the publisher's site due to the low-quality AI content.

data.Title: Back Button Hijacking: Impact on SEO and Google's Spam Policies
data.Description: Back button hijacking persists, with some publishers manipulating the back button. This practice's potential impact on Navboost, Google's spam policies, and aggressive advertising is explored.

data.Title: Microsoft Partners with StopNCII to Combat Revenge Porn on Bing
data.Description: Microsoft is collaborating with StopNCII to identify and eliminate AI-generated deepfake content and non-consensual intimate images from Bing search results, although deepfakes pose a challenge.

data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update: Volatility and Analysis
data.Description: The Google August 2024 core update has finished, but search ranking volatility remains high. Analysis and observations on the update's impact are provided.

data.Title: YouTube Studio Introduces Website Visits Goal for Promotions
data.Description: YouTube Studio now offers a website visits goal for promotions, allowing users to drive traffic from their YouTube channel to their websites. This update aims to simplify the process of promoting products or services directly from YouTube.

data.Title: DOJ Antitrust Lawsuit Targets Google's Ad Business
data.Description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) and multiple states have filed an antitrust lawsuit against Google, alleging a monopoly in the ad tech market. The trial is scheduled to begin on September 9th.

data.Title: Judge Delays Remedy Decision in Google Monopoly Case Until August 2025
data.Description: The judge overseeing the Google monopoly ruling has announced a delay in determining remedies until August 2025. Potential remedies include restrictions on deals featuring Google's search engine on mobile devices and even a potential breakup of the company.

data.Title: Replit Launches AI Agent for Building Apps from Prompts
data.Description: Replit has introduced Replit Agent, an AI agent capable of creating entire applications based on user prompts. Currently in beta for Replit Core and Teams subscribers, this agent goes beyond typical coding assistants.
